pullrequest.title: Fixes for compiling and running tests on Windows 7/Visual Studio 2013

content.raw:
I've modified the CI job for ign-math and now is able to test the external repositories and enable tests even if the configure script disabled them.

For this pull request, the only tests failing are those depending on fixing check_test_ran.py.

http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_math-any-devel-windows7-amd64/18/
content.html:
I've modified the CI job for ign-math and now is able to test the external repositories and enable tests even if the configure script disabled them.

For this pull request, the only tests failing are those depending on fixing check_test_ran.py.

http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_math-any-devel-windows7-amd64/18/

content.raw:
Thanks for the change. Just need to make `code_check.sh`  happy:


```
#!c++

./src/Kmeans_TEST.cc:103:  Lines should be <= 80 characters long  [whitespace/line_length] [2]
```

Could you split this across two lines?
content.html:
Thanks for the change. Just need to make code_check.sh happy:

./src/Kmeans_TEST.cc:103:  Lines should be <= 80 characters long  [whitespace/line_length] [2]

Could you split this across two lines?

content.raw: I removed this test just for MSVC, but I think it should removed in general (because I don't see why the RNG implementations should be consistent across platform/compilers/library implementations).
content.html: I removed this test just for MSVC, but I think it should removed in general (because I don't see why the RNG implementations should be consistent across platform/compilers/library implementations).
